projects.title: Aprila Kit
projects.ingress: New design system for Aprila Bank
projects.content: Aprila wanted a design system to unify their applications and make frontend development more efficient between teams. I built a design system with focus on maximum lifetime expectancy by using web standards. The components are both available as a web component library with UI behaviour, but also a CSS library if developers need to customize interactive behaviour.

projects.title: EMBL
projects.ingress: A modern and easy web site to showcase scientific research
projects.content: The Nordic EMBL Partnership for Molecular Medicine aims to address some of the biggest challenges in biomedicine today. Working closely together with [Erling Aarønæs](https://www.instagram.com/aaronaes.studio/), we developed a lightweight website with a focus on making it easy for EMBL to maintain the content.

projects.title: EmmaSofia
projects.ingress: Building a unifiying web platform for a non profit
projects.content: New unified styleguide, new websites and integration with their existing shopify web shop into their new webpage. I also made a Node.js server to connect different microservices like PayPal and AirTable to make a new automatic member system.

projects.title: Gro grønt
projects.ingress: Growing a brand for a container of salad and herbs in Oslo
projects.content: Growing exotic spices and vegetables with hydro culture in the middle of Oslo. Together with [Erling Aarønæs](https://www.instagram.com/aaronaes.studio/), we created their brand, complete with a design handbook and their first website.

projects.title: Hedwig
projects.ingress: New design system for Posten (The Norwegian Postal Service).
projects.content: Posten wanted a holistic design system to make it easier to maintain their visual identity when they develop new services. I was one of the main developers from Netlife Design creating the design system. We worked closely with the designers at Posten to implement components in CSS and JS.

projects.title: Hofbauer
projects.content: One pager I made for Christian Hofbauers new book Salgets Helter.

projects.title: Kontrakt
projects.ingress: Creating a brand for a traditional law firm to better highlight their expertise.
projects.content: We worked closely together as they redefined themself, with everything from a new name to letterheads.

projects.title: MiniØya
projects.ingress: Festival app for a kids festival
projects.content: To make it easier for parents on MiniØya to find food vendors, line-up and stage plan, as well as exit areas, I created an app together with [Martine Carlson](https://www.linkedin.com/in/martinecarlson/?originalSubdomain=no) at Empefire.

projects.title: Nabobudet
projects.ingress: Making a candy delivery service in Oslo
projects.linkText: Check out what we did on facebook
projects.content: As one of the creators and co-founders of Nabobudet, we developed the business we were missing ourselves. Nabobudet delivered whatever you might need (or just want) after regular supermarkets were closed, like chocolate or toilet paper.

projects.title: Oh Shit Git!
projects.ingress: A cli tool to help you unfuck your git mistakes
projects.content: A cli-tool I made because: git is hard: screwing up is easy, and figuring out how to fix your mistakes is fucking impossible.

projects.title: Spent
projects.content: A web app I made to make it easier to budget when I travel. Best viewed on a phone.

iaac.title: Drawings
iaac.content: Drawings I have made over the years.

iaac.title: Envision Festival
iaac.ingress: Building a theme camp for Envision
iaac.content: I was on a team of 5 building a theme camp for Envision Festival. We used a lot of natural materials like bamboo and drift wood to make lamps, hanging chairs, lounge areas, a bar and an entry portal.

iaac.title: Eye Candy
iaac.ingress: Art Direction for a photo shoot
iaac.content: Concept development for a fashion shoot. I designed the set and made the trees myself. Photography by Pål Laukli.

iaac.title: RatPark
iaac.ingress: Building open source software on a permaculture farm
iaac.content: I was living at Ratpark for 5 months making open source software for cooperatives. In this time I also gained experience working in the garden, building a tree house, doors and decorations for the compost toilets and much much more.
